pull.title: cmake: Add option to recreate precomputed files
pull.body:
Using the CMake-based build system enables smoother integration with parent projects by providing both CMake package configuration files and the traditional `libsecp256k1.pc`.

However, packagers on some systems, such as [Gentoo](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/secp256k1/blob/f9a944ff2dbcd7ff1829880636f861caf0a91392/Makefile.am#L83) and [Guix](https://codeberg.org/guix/guix/pulls/2566#issuecomment-7360201), insist on recreating the precomputed files, which is not currently supported by the CMake-based build system.

This PR addresses the issue by introducing a new build option, `SECP256K1_BUILD_PRECOMPUTED`, which is disabled by default.

repo.name: secp256k1
repo.description: Optimized C library for EC operations on curve secp256k1

repo.name: secp256k1
repo.description: Optimized C library for EC operations on curve secp256k1

events.body:
are we able to do this via `./configure`? 

or is this meant to be only done for CMake?

> are we able to do this via `./configure`?

Yes. Run `make clean-precomp && make precomp`.

@real-or-random 

Thank you for the review! Your feedback has been addressed.

verification.payload:
tree 2dffaec4248d48c7f5257c74ce936a242bd7b88e
parent 03a17d03f224f88f6c0663795cdbc9f245c9a13a
author Hennadii Stepanov <32963518+hebasto@users.noreply.github.com> 1767722915 +0000
committer Hennadii Stepanov <32963518+hebasto@users.noreply.github.com> 1769512972 +0000

ci: Add `-DSECP256K1_BUILD_PRECOMPUTED=ON` to CMake jobs

events.body:
> Rebased on the top of the first commit from #1794.

Rebased on top of the merged bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1794.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -45,10 +45,41 @@ if(SECP256K1_ENABLE_MODULE_ECDH)
   set_property(TARGET secp256k1 APPEND PROPERTY PUBLIC_HEADER ${PROJECT_SOURCE_DIR}/include/secp256k1_ecdh.h)
 endif()
 
-add_library(secp256k1_precomputed OBJECT EXCLUDE_FROM_ALL
-  precomputed_ecmult.c
-  precomputed_ecmult_gen.c
-)
+add_library(secp256k1_precomputed OBJECT EXCLUDE_FROM_ALL)
+if(SECP256K1_BUILD_PRECOMPUTED)
+  add_executable(secp256k1_precompute_ecmult EXCLUDE_FROM_ALL precompute_ecmult.c)
+  target_compile_definitions(secp256k1_precompute_ecmult PRIVATE VERIFY)
+  if(CMAKE_C_COMPILER_ID STREQUAL "MSVC")
+    # Disable warning C4334 "'operator': result of 32-bit shift implicitly converted to 64 bits (was 64-bit shift intended?)".
+    target_compile_options(secp256k1_precompute_ecmult PRIVATE /wd4334)
+  endif()
+  add_executable(secp256k1_precompute_ecmult_gen EXCLUDE_FROM_ALL precompute_ecmult_gen.c)
+  target_compile_definitions(secp256k1_precompute_ecmult_gen PRIVATE VERIFY)
+  set_target_properties(secp256k1_precompute_ecmult secp256k1_precompute_ecmult_gen PROPERTIES
+    RUNTIME_OUTPUT_DIRECTORY ${CMAKE_CURRENT_BINARY_DIR}
+  )
+
+  add_custom_command(
+    OUTPUT
+      ${CMAKE_CURRENT_BINARY_DIR}/precomputed_ecmult.c
+      ${CMAKE_CURRENT_BINARY_DIR}/precomputed_ecmult_gen.c
+    COMMAND secp256k1_precompute_ecmult
+    COMMAND secp256k1_precompute_ecmult_gen
+    DEPENDS secp256k1_precompute_ecmult secp256k1_precompute_ecmult_gen
+    WORKING_DIRECTORY ${PROJECT_BINARY_DIR}
+  )
comments.body: Shouldn't these conceptually be two separate commands?

comments.body: In which line does this warning appear? Could we fix it in the code instead?

comments.body:
> In which line does this warning appear?

https://github.com/bitcoin-core/secp256k1/blob/2d9137ce9d7e576bfada2859292ecaa0887a6b8c/src/ecmult.h#L41

> Could we fix it in the code instead?

Certainly. Fixed in 19529e70680a5edaa0210b74420693d8e689c7ac.

comments.body: I think conceptually the result of `ECMULT_TABLE_SIZE` should be a `size_t` because it is an array size. What do you think of this refactor instead? https://github.com/bitcoin-core/secp256k1/pull/1794
